    • Field Detail

      • resolution

        public static final float resolution
        How precise this scheduler runs. The value here represents how often the scheduler appraises its scheduled tasks and runs things. This value is in second. In other words, the scheduler cycles every 1 / resolution seconds.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

    • Method Detail

      • getScheduler

        public static UIScheduler getScheduler()

      • schedule

        public int schedule(UITickable task,
                    int n)
        Registers the task to be executed once over n cycles. Once cycle is defined as 1 / resolution seconds.

      • schedule

        public int schedule(UITickable task,
                    float n)
        Registers the task to be executed every n seconds. The precision of the scheduling is limited by the resolution. This method will round to the nearest number of cycles, and instead only serves as a convenience method to allow scheduling for a target amount of time instead of an abstract number of cycles.
        Returns:
        an integer key used for unregistering the task

      • unschedule

        public void unschedule(int key)
        Unregisters the task assigned to the given Identifying key

      • run

        public void run()
        Specified by:
        run in interface java.lang.Runnable
